noun.description: A district of a city or town as defined for police purposes.
The area within the walls or perceived boundaries of a particular building or place.
examples: all strata of society live within these precincts
beyond the precincts of my own family, I am quite inhibited

noun.description: An area in a town designated for specific or restricted use, especially one that is closed to traffic.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting an administrative district): from medieval Latin praecinctum, neuter past participle (used as a noun) of praecingere encircle, from prae before + cingere gird.
